name: Riverside Marches
economy_niches: harvest & processing of tide-herbs for auguries
sand and glass-supply for coastal crafts
pilotage, river-guides and local augury services
culture_adjustments: river-kinship networks stronger than open-coast kin ties
flood-season ritualism more elaborate and frequent
less market cosmopolitanism; Coastal Tongues dominant but localized dialects
guild apprenticeships focused on marshcraft and reed-construction
oral navigational lore emphasizes eddies, shallows, and seasonal channels
constraints: limited deep-harbour capacity for large vessels
ritual auguries consume scarce imported reagents
notes: primary supplier of augury-herbs to coastal guilds
pilotage guilds exert strong local control over tolls
seasonal roads often impassable during high tides
